headline.print_headline: Pandora and Big Labels Settle Suit for $90 Million
headline.main: Pandora and Big Labels Settle Suit for $90 Million

snippet: The deal involves recordings made before 1972, which are not covered by federal copyright protection.
abstract: Pandora Media reaches $90 million settlement with major record labels over royalties for older songs; reports third-quarter loss of $85.9 million, compared with $2 million loss in year-ago quarter; revenue was $311.6 million, up 30 percent over year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The deal involves recordings made before 1972, which are not covered by federal copyright protection.
